    Full Time 
   


Employment Type

    Regular 
   


Country

    Canada 
   


**Province/State (Primary)

    Ontario 
   


City (Primary)

    Toronto 
   


Work Location

    TD Centre - West - 100 Wellington Street West 
   


Job Expires

    27-Jun-2022

Title: Manager Master Data & Business Intelligence
Description:
West Fraser is a leading diversified forest products company listed on the TSX and NYSE. Recognized for the eighth time as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, we are a growing company looking for talented people to be part of our team. We have over 11,000 employees and operations in Canada, Southern United States, United Kingdom and Belgium.
 West Fraser continues to invest in our manufacturing facilities to ensure they are modern and competitive. We have a sustainable forestry practice and continue to innovate our processes and diversify our products, including investing in bioenergy.
 Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? Our office, located in the heart of Vancouver, has an opening for a:
 Manager, Master Data and Business Intelligence
 The Manager, Master Data and Business Intelligence will manage the resources and develop the strategy for defining, collecting, consolidation, and distribution of data across applications and reporting platforms.
 Responsibilities:

 Formulate and deploy long-term strategic plans for acquiring and enabling efficient and cost-effective business intelligence and data warehousing technologies
 Create and execute plans to realize the data management and governance vision, which contains the following elements: data cleansing, data governance, data analytics, data refresh, acquisition of external data (structured and unstructured) and external data exposure
 Establish policy, procedures, and review the entry of new master data for completeness, accuracy and compliance with internal business processes
 Support the business in developing the long-term improvement plans, ensuring there are clear action plans in place which are being executed and delivered against, supporting in the execution of the plans where necessary, and measuring and tracking delivery
 Develop and adhere to business intelligence and master data budgets and forecasts
 Work with the customer to develop business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for business intelligence spending and initiatives
 Active participation in the IT leadership team, contributing to strategic and tactical shared goals, and contributing to the overall leadership goals of IT
 Manage quality of data on an ongoing basis and providing thought leadership on data governance
 Establish and ensure sustainment of data infrastructure, including interacting with vendors and internal infrastructure and application teams to complete the implementation and maintain a repository and reporting solution
 Facilitate adoption of a business intelligence solution through the organization
 Establish and enforce governance of data to ensure data is robust, complete, accurate and available, including identifying and supporting data stewardship across the business
 Support data analytics strategies (e.g. outcome prediction) by implementing machine learning techniques Supervise business intelligence and master data management staffing, including recruitment, supervision, scheduling, development, evaluation, and disciplinary actions
 Manage department operational day to day activities such as developing business requirements, project planning, development of team resources, allocation of resources, customer service level agreements, and other typical IT managerial issues

 Position Requirements:

 Experience participating in at least one business transformation through data and/or analytics
 Minimum 5 years of Data Management, delivering complex data management engagements including all phases of the project life cycle from scoping and planning, requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and go live
 Experience with standardized BI solutions such as Oracle OBIEE or Microsoft Power BI are required
 Five years of related experience in a managerial capacity, preferably in a data analytics and data warehousing department
 Demonstrated experience in data architecture design and development, database development and management, and cross-functional team experience is an asset
 Excellent interpersonal and communications skills with the ability to deliver powerful presentations and proposals and interact with senior clients
 Experience leading Agile development efforts; planning multiple large projects, managing time, resources, priorities and goal achievement

 West Fraser believes strongly in promoting from within and we are looking for individuals who are interested in a full-time, long-term career. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company. We offer an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and an outstanding pension plan.
 If this position sounds like the career for you, submit your cover letter and resume at www.westfraser.com/jobs click "apply now" in green at the top of the page.

Title: SENIOR ANALYST, OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY
Description:
No other bank is doing what we do.

 At BDC, we help Canada and its entrepreneurs create a prosperous, inclusive and green economy. Our mission is to help Canadian businesses thrive by providing financing, capital and advisory services. We’re devoted to Canadian entrepreneurs. We’re also dedicated to our employees. Adaptable. Inspiring. Different. There’s a reason we like to work here, and we think you’ll like it too. Join BDC and help make a difference! 

Diversity. Equity. Inclusion. They’re more than just words for BDC. These concepts are foundational to our success and to our ability to attract, retain, mobilize and develop the right talent, as well as to offer a healthy, professional and collaborative environment. We are committed to cultivating and preserving an environment where all employees can thrive, and, for over a decade, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and one of Canada's Best Diversity Employers. In recruiting for our team, we welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran’s status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, beliefs, experiences, and more.

 POSITION OVERVIEW

 The Senior Analyst, Operational Efficiency contributes to the generation of efficiency through business transformation and operational effectiveness projects, with tangible and measurable benefits to the business lines or industry.

 CHALLENGES TO BE MET

 Contribute to the development, organization and evolution of the operational efficiency center of expertise
 Execute and deliver various mandates as a team or independently
 Conduct operational efficiency and process review projects - mandate definition, operational performance data analysis, workshop facilitation and reporting
 Ensure that deliverables provide value to the client by establishing a structured track record of benefits achieved.
 Follow up and support process owners to ensure that actions related to process improvement are implemented and produce the expected results
 Contribute to the development of a culture of continuous improvement of business processes (knowledge, behaviors, skills)
 Contribute to the development of education and training programs on good process management practices and on process analysis and improvement tools
 Support managers in assessing the level of performance of key processes and identify opportunities for improvement initiatives
 Organize, coordinate and facilitate process review workshops using ‘’Lean Six Sigma’’ tools
 Actively engage key contributors such as BDC's change management, communications and application owner teams in the implementation of business process changes
 Be involved in the evolution of the Operational Efficiency department
 Act as a promoter and coach in continuous improvement tools and methods
 Keep up to date with industry best practices for continuous improvement


 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

 Bachelor's degree in business administration, engineering or information technology
 3 years of experience as a business process analyst
 Master's degree considered an asset
 Experience in process development and improvement
 Experience in change management and project management (PMP or Scrum Master an asset)
 Ability to write in a structured, simple, concise and understandable way
 Ability to influence and negotiate with various stakeholders
 Ability to facilitate bilingual workshops involving multiple participants - excellent communicator, facilitator
 Expertise in presenting complex ideas or recommendations in a simple manner tailored to the audience
 Excellent interpersonal skills
 Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks
 Autonomy and ability to adapt quickly to IT changes
 Knowledge of frameworks and techniques (Lean, Six Sigma, Agile, Kaizen, Hoshin Kanri, BPMN, PDCA, DMAIC/DMADV, SIPOC, etc.)
 Green belt and above in Lean Six Sigma or Lean Master
 Knowledge of Visio software and Microsoft Office suite
 Experience with process mining or RPA an asset
 Bilingualism (English & French)


 With us, you'll be able to achieve the work/life balance you're looking for, with competitive working conditions and above-market flexible benefits. This includes modern workspaces to work from when you are in our offices, and, for some specific positions, the ability to work remotely, on reserve, and/or within your community.

 While we appreciate all applications, we advise that only the candidates selected to participate in the recruitment process will be contacted. If you are a candidate with a disability and need an accommodation to complete the application process, please email us at accessibility@BDC.ca, and include your full name, the best way to reach you, and the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process.

Title: Analyst in Immunochemistry
Description:
For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.


IMPORTANT: In order to be considered for this position, a resume/CV must be uploaded and submitted during the application process. Please make sure work history and education are added correctly.
 




We are currently seeking to hire an Analyst for our Immunochemistry team located in Ville St-Laurent. 
 How will you create an impact?  The Immunochemistry department mainly analyzes serum, plasma, and tissue samples to verify the concentration, toxicity, and stability of assay substances (large molecules) in order to determine the safety and efficacy of drugs.


Why Charles River?  We offer an excellent integration program for our new employees as well as opportunities for internal growth and career development. Our other perks include:


As of Day 1:

Competitive benefits & we pay 90% of premiums (health and dental coverage).
Access to a savings and retirement program with employer contribution.
Vacation and Personal Day Policy.
Free telemedicine app for you and your family.


 
Transportation:

Shuttle service from the Sainte-Anne-de Bellevue train station and from John Abbott College to the Senneville location.
Free parking.


 
Work Schedule & Salary:

Starting salary rate of $19.50/HR.
Permanent, full-time position from Monday to Friday.
Please note that training will be conducted at our Senneville location (West of Montreal).





What will you work on?




Working in our newly renovated laboratories, you will perform sample analysis work using various assays and techniques such as ELISA, Electrochemiluminescence, hybridization, and extractions. You will also perform data analysis to determine if results are within expectations; all in accordance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLP). 
 Who are we looking for?  We are seeking a motivated individual with either a DEC in Science (Biotechnology, Medical Laboratory, or equivalent) or a BAC in Science (Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry) who works with precision and strives for quality work. A self-starter with a collaborative and positive attitude. Must be comfortable working under English conditions, bilingualism is an asset. 
 If you are interested in contributing to the well-being of our communities, not only across the country but around the world, please join us and BE THE DIFFERENCE!

 



IMPORTANT: A resume is required to be considered for this position. If you have not uploaded your resume in your candidate profile, please return to upload field and attach your resume/CV. 
About Safety Assessment Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

Title: Business and Functional Analyst - Project Accounting
Payroll Analyst
Description:
Location: 
    Kitchener, ON.
  

    Job Type: 
    Full-Time
  

    Posting Date: 
    06/10/2022
  

    Closing Date: 
    07/29/2022
  


 
Payroll Analyst
 We are currently looking for someone to join our team in the permanent role of Payroll Analyst. This position is based out of our corporate office located in Kitchener Ontario, with remote working options also available. 
Reporting to the Director of Finance, the Payroll Analyst, will be supporting the roll out and implementation of our new payroll system. This person will work closely with the payroll team and the Director of Finance to ensure a successful transition to the new system while using creative measures to troubleshoot and improve efficiencies. 
The ideal candidate will have solid experience implementing systems, has a thirst for knowledge, exceptional excel and report building skills, an enthusiastic go-getter attitude, with a strong focus on attention to detail and finding solutions.
 To apply, please email a copy of your resume to: Recruiter.Lindsay@CarePartners.ca


 WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?
 In addition to a competitive salary and access to group benefits and RRSP programs, your future colleagues want to tell you that you’ll enjoy… 

“working within a knowledgeable and collaborative team” 
“working within a learning environment and having an opportunity to gain skills” 
“work life balance and flexibility” 
“working for a company that provides essential health care and positively impacts the lives of so many Ontarians”



 WHAT THE ROLE ENTAILS:

Supporting the implementation and deployment of the new payroll system (PDS Vista)
Acting as the subject matter expert for PDS Vista and the payroll functions within
Being able to identify and map current and desired future state processes with the payroll team
Acting as the lead payroll implementation specialist to support configuration of the new system
Building and developing training materials for end-users and trainers
Guiding users to use the system to full potential while troubleshooting issues and challenges
Monitoring key indicators in the payroll processes and relaying information
Identifying areas for improvement and work collaboratively with the teams to enhance the system
In collaboration with the team, ensuring oversight on pieces that impact payroll such as government reporting, employee federal and provincial income taxes, employment insurance, workplace safety insurance, unions, benefit and pension payments
Implementing contract changes in payroll system
Assist in troubleshooting application issues, and perform enhanced trouble shooting with internal stakeholders and external partners, as required
Working with stakeholders to, document, test and monitor the system while keeping record of the changes 
Evaluate and recommend changes to applicable CarePartners’ policies and procedures
Performing other duties as assigned

WHAT YOU BRING:

1+ years related work experience in an analyst role with some background in payroll or finance
Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, technology or a related field.
You will be a Master at Excel! You'll be analyzing data.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.
Comprehension and understanding of payroll legislation (PCP preferred). 
Strong HRIS, payroll or finance systems experience (Sage preferred).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced Excel skills and demonstrated ability to produce high quality reports. 
Proficiency in MS Office software applications.
Comprehension and understanding of payroll legislation (PCP preferred). 
Strong HRIS, payroll or finance systems experience (Sage preferred).
Knowledge of government funded, community home health care industry considered an asset.
Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build, establish and maintain collaborative relationships with the payroll team, internal and external stakeholders.



 CarePartners promotes and facilitates, as appropriate, the immunization of employees in order to provide a safe working environment for its employees, to deliver safe care to patients and to fulfill its commitment to evidence- based health promotion. In accordance with Public Health and Government directives CarePartners has implemented safety protocols to prevent the spread of infectious diseases such as COVID-19. All employees will be required to wear appropriate Personal Protective Equipment as directed by CarePartners and mandated by public health authorities. All new hires of CarePartners are required at this time to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19, in accordance with our policies and procedures.


 CAREPARTNERS IS IN YOUR COMMUNITY
 In addition to providing home-based personal support, rehabilitation and therapy, nursing and palliative care across Ontario, CarePartners also serves the community through clinics, transitional care units, and provides relief in nursing homes and shared care settings.
 Through our outreach program, we’ve been organizing medical care and clinics in countries with poor access to health care since 2009.
 CarePartners welcomes and encourages applicants from people with disabilities, accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the hiring process.

Title: Lead Security Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 Lead Security Analyst (Threat Hunting and Detection Engineering)
 ENABLING THE DIGITAL WORLD
 OpenText enables the digital world by simplifying, transforming, and accelerating enterprise information needs, on premises or in the cloud. We embrace all things digital and are committed to being the Best Place to Work for our Employees in over 140 locations around the world.  We obsess over our customers to ensure they are wildly successful in embracing the Digital World. Our customers entrust us with their most important information, we need to be their most trusted partner. What we do, we do well. What we create, we do purposefully to impact the world. If you believe in this and are passionate about enabling the Digital World then let OpenText turn your career vision into reality. 
 The Opportunity:
 The Threat Hunting Analyst is a key member of Open Text’s Cyber Security team and will posses strong operational and analytical experience in Threat Hunting and Detection Engineering. This position is also focused on maturing the Threat Hunting program. The successful candidate will develop threat detection and analysis techniques from Threat Intelligence, threat trends and security tools to drive improvements in security monitoring and alerting capabilities. This hands-on role requires deep technical knowledge of security monitoring, security operations, network and systems analysis, threat modeling and threat detection.

 You are great at:


 Researching and understanding Cybersecurity threats, threat actors, trends in adversary activities, attack vectors and Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTPs).
 Using threat modeling and attack frameworks to develop advanced detection mechanisms for a variety of security tools and technologies to identify, detect and respond to malicious activity.
 Leveraging intelligence derived from Threat Hunting to improve overall Security Operations, tool visibility, threat awareness, and detection and response.
 Driving the implementation and consistent operation of the Threat Hunting program. 
Leading security program improvements and efficiencies across security technologies, processes, and services.
 Optimizing security tools deployment and introducing scalable security services. 
Building and coordinating plans for transition and integration of an acquired company’s security operations, tools, services, and processes.
 Continually building automation and tooling capabilities for the deployment and management of our internal security services.
 Driving continuous improvement of the acquisition security integration playbook.
 Proactively search for Threats to prevent or minimize Cybersecurity attacks.
 Ability to communicate to technical and management levels.
 Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources, providing key analytics.
 Document findings in an easy-to-read format.
 Perform other duties and responsibilities necessary.


 What it takes:

 BS in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Assurance, or Information Security preferred.
 7+ years of experience and demonstrated success in technology leadership with emphasis on security and infrastructure and cloud.
 3+ years technical management experience, including experience leading large-scale, demanding, and information security projects.
 Technical skills with IT security components, including firewalls, UTM, ATP, TVM, IAM, security analytics, server operating systems, and other industry-standard techniques and practices.
 Hands-on experience in forensic science, data analysis, intelligence analysis, malware reversing, network and endpoint security, adversary tracking, and other security-related tasks.
 Demonstrated experience generating metrics to measure service and program effectiveness.
 Strong written and presentation skills with the ability to communicate effectively with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
 Must be able to work in a fast paced and changing environment while handling multiple tasks, priorities, and directives. Capable of working under pressure. 
CISSP, GCIH, CISA, CISM, or other industry certifications preferred.
 Experience with MITRE ATT&CK framework preferred.


 Work Location
 
The location for the position is in Canada, Alpharetta, GA, Brook Park, OH, other US locations.

 
OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com).

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Senior Analyst – Energy Market Operations
Description:
Rodan Energy is a leading North American provider of solutions that help our customers meet their goal of having a reliable, sustainable supply of power. Together, we are making sustainable, attainable!
 Rodan is recognized as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for three years in a row! This is a terrific place to learn and grow in your career. Our team of energy analysts, engineers, and metering experts, combined with our industry-leading energy intelligence software platforms, are helping energy users and power companies navigate the energy transition.
 We have an exciting opportunity available for Senior Analyst, Energy Market Operations. Reporting into the Manager, Energy Market Operations, you will support delivery of energy solutions that provide clients with opportunities to maximize their market revenues, reduce their total energy spend, and enhance overall system efficiency. Rodan is looking for an ambitious individual who takes initiative to solve problems and meet deadlines and is looking to grow their knowledge base of the various Independent Systems Operator (ISO) electricity markets.
 This role will start your career in helping build a sustainable energy future!
 **This is a flexible hybrid role where you are required to work both remotely and in person depending on business needs. You will be required to work at our Corporate HQ in Mississauga to attend and participate in workshops, projects, or team meetings.**
 Main Responsibilities & Duties:

Manage all aspects of demand management programs for the Northeast U.S. ISO markets and utility programs (“own your market”)
Support U.S. business development activities through customer information analysis to assess suitability of clients for available monetization and savings opportunities
Responsible for Rodan portfolio performance in meeting DR/Capacity Auction program commitments
Managing all aspects of client registration, metering and data management for ISO/utility program
Develop/foster relationships with applicable ISO/utility staff.
Support development of best-in-market solutions, leveraging experience across jurisdictions
Work closely with Rodan Regulatory Affairs Team to ensure efficient transfer of knowledge, solutions and ideas
Other duties as required

Requirements:

Post-secondary education in business, engineering, project management or related field – or equivalent in training, experience and education
5+ years of in-depth understanding of energy and capacity markets, particularly in demand response activities
Quick and accurate modelling and analysis of large sets of financial and other customer data
Knowledge of electricity market rules and energy savings/incentive programs
Strong data analysis skills
Advanced computer skills (MS Office, Outlook)
Willingness to travel within North America

Qualifications & Skills:

Strong technical, analytical, and financial or mathematical aptitude
Ability to accurately summarize information
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
High level of commitment to exceptional customer service and experience
Capacity to form effective relationships with users
Highly organized and able to prioritize tasks
Proven ability to work well under pressure and meet all deadlines
Ability to adjust and be flexible to meet changing work needs and demands
Resourceful, self-starter who takes initiative to solve problems and meet deadlines
Strong organization and time-management skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Easily liaises and interacts with all types of personalities

RODAN BENEFITS:

Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
Health benefits after probationary period (medical, dental, vision, health care spending, life insurance, LTD, AD&D,)
3 weeks vacation
RRSP annual contribution top up
Employee assistance program (24/7 benefits to address problems that are personal or work related ie. psychological, financial, legal and parental support services)
Teledoc (24/7 access to Doctors by phone, video or app)

Rodan Energy is strongly committed to diversity and equality of opportunity. We strive to create an environment that is welcoming and inclusive for everyone.
 Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, applicants must confirm that they are Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19. If Applicants are not Fully Vaccinated, they will be asked to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. If no such accommodation is identified, the Applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.
 We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Supply Chain Governance Senior Analyst
Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

 McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 12 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
 
 At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
 

Job Summary

 Reporting to the Senior Director, Supply Chain Management and Governance, the Supply Chain Governance Senior Analyst, is responsible to:
 

 Support the end-to-end supply chain process stream aimed at ensuring flawless execution of service level performance targets.
 Implement a LEAN governance system to drive accountability and alignment of key performance indicators.
 Implement and lead multi-disciplinary planning reviews aimed at promoting effective communication flows to ensure optimal cross- collaboration.
 Orchestrate root cause analysis and problem-solving initiatives to pro-actively manage risk and reduce potential banner related penalties.
 Work in close collaboration with various cross-functional stakeholders to drive efficiency through continuous improvement initiatives and innovation.
 Be an advocate to communicate a clear vision and need for change within the organization that generates excitement, enthusiasm, and commitment to the process.
 Conduct benchmarks and instill best in class supply chain business.
 Consolidating relevant information and synthesizing it for executive level awareness, including, making good sense of data, and performing in depth analysis, socializing challenges with Procurement Operations stakeholders.

 Key focus areas include good service levels, healthy inventory, accurate forecasts, and timing of launches (ex: promotions, new modular/planogram events, etc...) that are all in-line with the company’s financial targets.
 

Section A – Specific Responsibilities

 Governance and Communication (40%)
 

 Prepare and support governance meetings to report on results, banner contractual and internal KPIs, risks and challenges with management team.
 Understands, values, and communicates enterprise interdependencies and leverages this insight to enable informed decision making.
 Works in collaboration with key internal stakeholders including but not limited to; Promotion Planning/Demand Planning/Planogram/Supply Planning/Operations/Sales and Customer Service to drive flawless execution of Supply Chain plans.
 Liaises with the key internal and external (banner) stakeholders to ensure flawless execution of supply chain plans, customer commitments and enhance collaboration on past and forthcoming inventory quantities.
 Prepare presentations to the senior management team.

 Data analytics (40%)
 

 Monitors and masters raw service level performance and engages with key stakeholders with the goal of collaboration and commitment to improvements.
 Based on banner contractual agreement regarding penalties, analyses penalties and provides inputs on areas to further discuss with the banners and the Account Management team.
 Anticipates challenges on service levels and establishes contingency plans to address issues before they impact performance.
 Enhances reporting capabilities, in collaboration with System & Analytics team, to illustrate a clear picture of fill rate performance as part of the governance.

 Process improvements and Strategy Setting (15%)
 

 With the help of analytics and various support teams, identifies risks in the supply chain and develops the appropriate contingency plans to overcome them
 Collaborates closely with the Supply Planning team to propose inventory parameter adjustments and placing and monitoring of Rush orders where required.
 Collaborates closely with the Demand Planning team for forecast development internally and externally (suppliers and customers).
 Considers the long-term impacts of decisions and actions; spots new trends, potential problems, and opportunities early and communicates to governance team.
 Constructively challenges the standard way of doing things and helps identify areas for process improvement; applies creative problem solving and resourcefulness when everyday issues arise.
 In collaboration with internal stakeholders, leads sessions to improve processes leading to higher service levels and healthier inventory.

 Change Management (5%)
 

 Effectively engages stakeholders, minimizing risk to efficient adoption and maximizing benefits through a focus on the organizational, cultural and people aspects of business transformations.
 Applies change management principles and methodologies for stakeholder adoption.
 Generates excitement with the team to create engagement and commitment to improving.

 Other (5%)
 

 Maintains relevant business knowledge of product categories and stays abreast of market and industry trends and conditions.
 Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.


 Section B – Position Requirements

 Working Experience
 

 7+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management, Sales & Operations planning and customer service, and / or procurement.
 Retail/Wholesale experience an asset.

 Education
 

 Bachelor’s Degree in Supply chain related field, Business Administration, Operations Management, or equivalent.
 MBA or MSc, CPIM or SCMP designations are assets.
 Lean Six Sigma Green Belt is an asset.
 PMP certification is an asset.

 Personal Development and Soft Skills
 

 Demonstrates the ability to solve complex problems and create effective and innovative solutions in order to develop solid strategies
 Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, focused, rigorous, and committed to meeting deadlines
 Strong business acumen.
 Demonstrated leadership.
 High proficiency in French and English (written and spoken).
 Strong communication skills; adapts to the audience, active listening
 Comfortable interacting/presenting to a large group of individuals.
 Good change management skills.

 Technical Skills
 

 Proficiency with ERP systems and Replenishment systems an asset.
 Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).
 Knowledge of process and project management.

 Other Skills and Capabilities
 

 Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.
 Ability to identify operational and strategic issues and proactively drive solutions.
 Ability to work as part of multi-functional teams.
 Minimal travel might be required.
 #LI-JT2


 Worker Type
 Regular

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 Insight Global is looking for a Business Analyst/Product Owner to join one of the largest athletic apparel companies in North America, lululemon, on a 12-month contract to support their Costing Excellence project. The goal of this project is to implement and mature the RM and FG costing capabilities, processes, and tools to enable lululemon to look at any cost element within their materials or finished goods. In this role, you will be responsible to plan, facilitate and execute business analysis activities including but not limited to, problem/opportunity identification, process mapping, defect analysis, requirements elicitation and solution design. Acts as liaison between business and technology stakeholders. Rationalizes and understands how technology can solve business problems. Through adaptable planning and communication skills, they work collaboratively, negotiating requirements and priorities across multiple groups. Curiosity, creative problem solving, and teamwork are all essential for success in this role. 
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
 5 years in a Business Analyst role supporting technology-related projects; preferably within a retail environment  Strong understanding of ETL processes, data flows, and data extraction  Needs to have strong business analyst fundamentals: managing backlogs, writing stories, working with epics, process definition, systems mapping, and functional test planning Working experience with Agile project methodologies, development teams, and business analyst teams  Jira and Confluence experience 
 DESIRED SKILLS
 Experience with Bamboo Rose or other Costing software (Finished Goods and/or Raw Materials)Agile certification is an asset. (CSPO, SAFe POPM) Familiarity with DevOps practices like Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment.  Preference for digital asset management experience including 3D design and rendering.

Title: OmniaBio: Business Systems Analyst, ERP/MRP Systems
Company: Centre for Commercialization of Regenerative Medicine
Description:
About OmniaBio:
 OmniaBio Inc, a subsidiary of Toronto-based CCRM, is a contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) producing gene-modified cell therapies and viral vectors, compliant with cGMP standards. The facility has support from the Government of Ontario, via the Invest Ontario Fund, and is the first project to be funded through the Life Sciences Strategy. The facility will be built in phases with the ultimate goal of building the largest facility of its kind in Canada (over 350,000 sq ft). OmniaBio is Canada’s first commercial-scale CDMO dedicated to cell and gene therapies. Located on the biomanufacturing campus at McMaster Innovation Park (Hamilton, ON), OmniaBio will catalyze life sciences careers and innovation in Canada while advancing pioneering medicine with the potential to cure, not just treat, many forms of cancer, cardiovascular diseases, Parkinson’s, and diabetes, amongst others. OmniaBio will support a broad range of cell and gene therapy companies globally, enabling pivotal/Phase III and commercial-scale manufacturing. OmniaBio will complete CCRM’s continuum of process development, clinical and commercial capabilities. CCRM is a leader in developing and commercializing regenerative medicine-based technologies, and cell and gene therapies. 


Role Summary:
 The Business Systems Analyst, ERP/MRP Systems reports to the Project Manager, ERP/MRP Systems. This position requires analytical and critical thinking skills and the ability to understand business processes and objectives. The role of the ERP/MRP Business Systems Analyst is to elicit, analyze, specify and validate the business needs of project stakeholders in finance, accounting, procurement, manufacturing and others to assist with the ERP system selection, implementation and ongoing support and improvements. This includes interviewing stakeholders, and gathering and compiling user requirements, to convey to the technical teams throughout the software implementation life cycle. The ERP Analyst will also apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to support the development process, and to ensure that project deliverables meet specifications. The ERP Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring the IT team understands the business requirements. As well to ensure support, improvements and optimization of systems enhance business processes optimal performance. 


Responsibilities:
 Strategy and Planning 


Collaborate with project managers and project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Identify project stakeholders and establish user classes, as well as their characteristics.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements through workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish the scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define impact, outcome criteria and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and the project team to prioritize requirements.
Research, review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing data collection processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
 Acquisition and Deployment 


Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support the selection efforts.
Participate in the quality analysis of selected solutions to ensure that the features and functionalities have been enabled and optimized.
Participate in the creation of operational procedures and documentation for software solutions that the organization may opt to use.
 Operational Management 


Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to write requirements specifications accurately and concisely.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to ERP consultants, developers and the project team.
Assist with developing prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options, align with ERP consultants and support personnel, and communicate recommendations back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project or enhancement lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, ERP consultants, vendors and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Analyze day-to-day functions and processes of the system to ensure performance within predetermined guidelines, limits and specifications.
Identify and resolve application issues to maintain services, enhance capabilities and prevent system outages.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in ERP applications across the organization.

Requirements:


5+ years’ experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and methodology development.
Previous experience in the gathering of requirements for the selection, implementation, and on-going support of ERP and MRP systems.
Demonstrated knowledge of the core ERP business processes, including procurement, finance, manufacturing and warehousing (material management) processes and operations is essential.
Experience in supporting multiple ERP systems, preferably in a biotechnology or life sciences environment.
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.
Experience in business process mapping tools and techniques.
Understanding of business systems analysis, application development and software development life cycle concepts.
Working exposure to the design, development and implementation of software solutions.
Ability to work positively in a matrixed environment with several business units, IT teams and vendor resources.
Strong understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Good Automated Manufacturing Practices (GAMP) standards including the computer system validation process for GxP systems is preferred.
Experience in IT and Quality change control processes.
University degree in computer science, science or business.

Desired Characteristics:


Working experience with contract development and manufacturing organizations (CDMOs) is an asset
CBAP Certification or equivalent would be an asset
Ability to exercise independent judgment and act.
Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Highly self-motivated and independent.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.
Strong customer service orientation.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Possesses a team-oriented approach to meeting goals and objectives.
Demonstrated ability to complete tasks successfully without supervision and to work in a deadline-driven and dynamic environment.
Strong organizational skills.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities and ability to work as a team player in a highly collaborative organization.
 OmniaBio Inc. is a developing organization and represents a fluid working environment. Flexibility and adaptability are essential, and duties will be influenced by the needs of the organization. 

 Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada. 

 OmniaBio Inc. is committed to accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process, providing the applicant has met the bona fide requirements for the open position. Applicants should make their requirements known once contacted to schedule an interview, or when the job offer has been made.

Title: Data Warehouse Quality Assurance Analyst
Description:
As the Data Warehouse QA you will: 

 Have a s trong background in functional testing with the ability to design and develop test strategy and test cases.
Ability to review technical requirements with data warehouse and business intelligence terminology to produce test strategies, test scenarios, and test cases for the data warehouse team.
Creates the Test Plan for the software release, defining resources, and test suites required for each test cycle, dependencies, risks, and the overall strategy for testing complex systems and applications.
Performs all aspects of verification, including functional, structural, regression and system testing.
Experience participating in all aspects of a full-lifecycle development methodology, and related quality concepts and processes.
Ability to lead a distributed testing effort.
Excellent attention to detail.
Ability to work in an agile environment with an iterative approach to development

 MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class otherwise protected under applicable human rights legislation. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled and all other qualified applicants

 The Data Warehouse QA will have: 

 Experience in EDW testing.
Proficient in SQL and database systems
Track record of completing assignments on time with a high degree of quality.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to set priorities and multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Extensive knowledge of testing process, testing methodology analysis and defect reporting tools.
Ability to work independently and productively under pressure.
Strong organizational skills and decision making ability.

 One of Canada's best known insurance firms.
 Interesting technical work, a good overall compensation package.

Title: SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Materials Management
Description:
Job Title:  SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Materials Management
Division:  Bailey Metal Products Limited – Concord
Department:  Information Systems
Reports to:  Director Information Systems
Revision Date: January 1st, 2022
Job Purpose Summary
The SAP Business Analyst is responsible for evaluating, designing, and implementing SAP (Systems Applications and Products) software programs for Bailey Metal Products to help manage such areas as sales, distribution, inventory, production, and marketing within a single program. The specific focus for this role will be on the SAP S4 MM (Materials Management) and SD (Sales & Distribution) modules and functionality. The first key function will be to lead and work, as a member of the project team, to upgrade the current SAP ECC system to S4 HANA. The primary responsibility of this role is to implement and develop core business processes in Order Fulfillment, Logistics with integration to Finance, and Materials Management. Provide analysis of enterprise resources planning, customer relationship, financial, and supply chain management practices and strategies to determine how to apply SAP software programs. The incumbent can make changes to or customize existing programs or add new programs to existing platforms. The SAP Business Analyst can also train associates in the use of the SAP software. The success of this role relies on a good mix of technical, business, and interpersonal skills and the ability to differentiate between business processes and the technologies that enable them.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities
The responsibilities and accountabilities of the position will be to lead as a technical and functional expert in analyzing, designing, and developing solutions for SAP enhancements and continuous process improvement, but not limited to:

Provide leadership and work with the project team to ensure the successful upgrade of the current SAP ECC system to S4 HANA.
Perform process impact analysis as well as related SAP functional/technical activities (blueprint, design, prototype, test, cut over and deploy) for continuous improvement enhancement requests, with a specific focus on SAP MM and SD.
Provide business systems support for SAP MM, SAP SD and other SAP modules and applications external to SAP, i.e., SharePoint etc., along with working knowledge to assist the Network Systems Analyst with Desktop configuration and support, when applicable.
Working with users to define user requirements, functional requirements, and technical specifications, as well, as provide user training when needed.
Lead Fit-Gap analysis and documenting AS-IS and TO-BE processes.
Reviewing and analyzing solution enhancement requests to determine complexity.
Developing user and technical specifications to support development of approved solutions.
Authoring and execution of test scripts, required to maintain a validated system state.
First point of contact for any SAP User related issues.
Recommend strategies that are both compliant and efficient in accordance with company compliance guidelines.
Hands on responsibility in developing and demonstrating SAP capabilities by preparing and delivering demos, authoring training materials and delivering training.
Must be client focused working in a team-oriented environment, as well as possess ability to work autonomously reporting priorities and progress to management.
Work on various interrelated projects consisting of end-to-end system architecture.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study — or equivalent working experience.
Minimum of 5 - 7 years of experience in IS.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP ECC 6.0 and at least 1 year of experience with S4 HANA.
Minimum of 3 years of strong configuration and modifications experience in SAP MM and SAP SD.
In-depth experience in designing and implementing information solutions.
Ensures alignment of data architecture with data governance policies, guidelines, and standards.
Strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help support the requirements, design, documentation processes align to specification.
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to create marketing and messaging materials that meet stakeholder preferences.
Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.
Desire strong motivation to rapidly learn and implement new technologies.
Working knowledge and exposure to computer support and configuration.
Experience with SQL DB or HANA is a plus.
Experience in Microsoft SQL Server.
Experience with Reporting tools (SQL Reporter, Tableau) is a plus
Experience with Winshuttle is a plus.
Experience in Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) tools is an asset.
Experience in SAP FI, WM, TM, APO would be an asset.
Working knowledge of EDI would be an asset.
Familiarity with business process models is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Dental care
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:Masks required to be worn on company premises. High touch surfaces are sanitized regularly. Daily Covid-19 screening questions and temperature checks conducted. Physical distancing and other Covid-19 protocols in place.
Ability to commute/relocate:

Concord, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

What is your salary expectation?

Title: Senior Product Owner - Business Intelligence & Analytics 100% Remote
Description:
Our client is a global organization dedicated to putting information at the service of medicine. The companies and people aim to improve medical care by serving those who need it, those who provide it and those who seek to improve it. Organizations primary purpose is to help clients increase the effectiveness of activities pertaining to scientific communication, medical education and product/service marketing. To this end, we want our information services to contribute to the goals we share with our clients, namely: to accelerate the advancement of medicine and help people enjoy better, longer lives.
Position Summary 
As a Product Owner for the Business Intelligence and Analytics group, this resource will help coordinate and drive engagement with the products that deliver information to end users. This team member will work in close collaboration with business channel groups to establish business needs. These would be then delivered in the form of data integration or analytic products to drive innovation. This role will be the main point of contact for new and existing data analytic services leveraging our database and BI technologies. This team member will help define the product roadmap with the support of executive leadership.
Requirements & scope: 

Owner of data and reporting products at the enterprise level, focused on delivery of product innovation client facing analytics and 3rd party subscription service platforms.


Work with business users, business analysts and project managers to understand the the scope & clear set of requirements for the deliverables


Facilitates the delivery of executive level visualizations and product roadmap that translates analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for the business.


Partner with technical team and architects to ensure the availability of data and design needed to execute the project/tasks. Provide the effort estimates to director needed to execute these projects/ tasks


Conduct the regular standups to communicate the status, escalations and team capacity to the management


Manage the stakeholder’s expectations and ensure timely delivery of projects meeting quality standards


Lead the activities like project kickoff, updates and closures by partnering with PMs


Be a KANBAN process coach to the technical team ensuring the agreed delivery process is followed and is sustainably improving


Participates in and provides recommendations for ongoing business planning and departmental prioritization activities.


Build strong relationships with business partners via regular meetings, collaboration and involving them in demos and regular updates


Outline the key metrics to assess the overall growth and engagement users of our analytic and data products.


Suggest and advise the business on improving, updating or adding new metrics to measure the goals & strategy Who you are


Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in IT/Math/Quantitative discipline/ Business management

Experience in stakeholder management and project delivery Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

8+ years of experience as business analyst, data analyst or technical consultant preferably in pharma or medical industry


Understanding of database and concepts like schema, Table design and data integrity


Exposure to testing data visualization products and solutions


Experience with version control and change management


Exposure to Tableau, Google sheets and Snowflake (or any database)


Understanding of development process using JIRA (or any other scrum tools)


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills


Motivated to create something new and take ownership of said product


A pioneer in out of the box thinking, supporting innovation by way of technology

Who you are: 

Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in IT/Math/Quantitative discipline/ Business management


Experience in stakeholder management and project delivery


Excellent analytical and problem solving skills


8+ years of experience as business analyst, data analyst or technical consultant preferably in pharma or medical industry


Understanding of database and concepts like schema, Table design and data integrity


Exposure to testing data visualization products and solutions


Experience with version control and change management


Exposure to Tableau, Google sheets and Snowflake (or any database)


Understanding of development process using JIRA (or any other scrum tools)


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills


Motivated to create something new and take ownership of said product


A pioneer in out of the box thinking, supporting innovation by way of technology

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $120,000.00-$140,000.00 per year
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Extended health care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

Product Management: 8 years (preferred)
Business analysis: 8 years (preferred)
Data Analyst: 7 years (preferred)
Healthcare or Pharma: 5 years (preferred)
Data and Reporting: 7 years (preferred)
KANBAN: 5 years (preferred)
Databases: 7 years (preferred)
Tableau: 5 years (preferred)
Snowflake: 5 years (preferred)
Jira: 5 years (preferred)

Title: SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Sales Distribution
Description:
Job Title:  SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Sales Distribution
Division:  Bailey Metal Products Limited – Concord

Title: Customer Support Analyst, Custom Delivery Operations
Description:
Position Purpose:
 Provides expertise and systems support in producing custom client deliverables. Ensures a high level of quality through quality assurance checks on a range of custom client deliveries.

 Principal Accountabilities:
 Under general direction, performs production and quality assurance tasks on an assigned workload of custom client deliveries. Highlights data and/or functionality issues, performs preliminary root cause analysis and initiates issue investigation process when required. Solves complex problems using analysis and troubleshooting skills to determine root cause where appropriate.
 When necessary, prepares documentation and provides training to an offshore team. Works closely with the offshore team to ensure that delivery commitments are met and that appropriate quality issues are identified through predetermined quality assurance checks. Reviews the work of the offshore team assigned to their deliveries, makes final provisioning decisions and recommends process changes when necessary.

 Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required:
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Commerce or Information Systems or equivalent experience of 2-3 years in production and data analysis.

 Additional Requirements:
 Ability to communicate effectively with various levels in the organization (written and oral). Demonstrated problem solving, analytical and strong customer service skills. Proven troubleshooting skills and data mining skills. Demonstrated ability in Access, Excel, VBA, Oracle, SQL Server, PL/SQL, UNIX and Windows. The incumbent must be flexible, detail oriented, an independent worker, able to work under pressure in a multitasking environment, a team player, deadline-driven, committed to client quality and proficient at working cross-functionally to develop solutions and resolve issues.
 Experience in the pharma industry and/or knowledge of IQVIA datasets (TSA, CS, CDH, GPM, and Xponent), as well as BI tools (i.e. MicroStrategy, Qlik Sense, and Tableau) are an asset.

 IQVIA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of any applicable prohibited ground of discrimination, including but not limited to race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available at all stages of the recruitment process upon request. If you have a physical impairment or a disability that requires an accommodation, we encourage you to disclose this during the recruiting process so that IQVIA can appropriately accommodate you.

 Objet du poste :
 Fournit une expertise et un soutien systémique dans la production de livrables personnalisés pour les clients. Assure un haut niveau de qualité grâce à des contrôles d’assurance qualité sur une gamme de livraisons personnalisées des clients.

 Principales responsabilités :
 Sous la direction générale, effectue des tâches de production et d’assurance de la qualité sur une charge de travail assignée de livraisons client personnalisées. Met en évidence les problèmes de données et/ou de fonctionnalité, effectue une analyse préliminaire des causes profondes et lance un processus d’enquête sur les problèmes au besoin. Résout des problèmes complexes en utilisant des compétences d’analyse et de dépannage pour déterminer la cause première, le cas échéant.
 Au besoin, préparer la documentation et fournir de la formation à l’équipe extracôtière. Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe extracôtière pour s’assurer que les engagements en matière d’exécution sont respectés et que les problèmes de qualité appropriés sont cernés au moyen de vérifications prédéterminées de l’assurance de la qualité. Examine le travail de l’équipe offshore affectée à ses livraisons, prend les décisions finales d’approvisionnement et recommande des changements de processus si nécessaire.

 Études minimales, expérience et connaissances spécialisées requises :
 Baccalauréat ou équivalent en commerce ou systèmes d’information ou expérience équivalente de 2-3 ans dans la production et l’analyse de données.

 Exigences supplémentaires :
 Capacité de communiquer efficacement avec les différents niveaux de l’organisation (écrit et oral). Démonstration de compétences démontrées en résolution de problèmes, en analyse et en service à la clientèle. Compétences éprouvées en matière de dépannage et d’exploration de données. Capacité démontrée dans Access, Excel, VBA, Oracle, SQL Server, PL / SQL, UNIX et Windows. Le titulaire doit être flexible, soucieux du détail, un travailleur indépendant, capable de travailler sous pression dans un environnement multitâche, un joueur d’équipe, axé sur les délais, engagé envers la qualité du client et compétent dans le travail interfonctionnel pour développer des solutions et résoudre les problèmes.
 Une expérience dans le secteur pharmaceutique et/ou une connaissance des ensembles de données IQVIA (TSA, CS, CDH, GPM et Xponent), ainsi que des outils de BI (c’est-à-dire MicroStrategy, Qlik Sense et Tableau) sont un atout.

 IQVIA est fière d'être un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances et nous nous engageons à créer un environnement diversifié et inclusif. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la base de tout motif de discrimination interdit applicable, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil ou le handicap. Des accommodements pour les candidats avec un handicap sont disponibles à toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement, sur demande. Si vous souffrez d'une déficience ou d’un handicap physique nécessitant un accommodement, nous vous encourageons à le divulguer lors du processus de recrutement afin qu'IQVIA puisse vous accommoder de manière appropriée.

 IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Senior HR Forecaster/Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We acknowledge that Providence Health Care & the new St. Paul’s Hospital site is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x?m?θkw?y??m (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and S?l?ílw?ta?/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
 The Opportunity:  Providence Health Care’s HR Systems & Reporting team is currently looking for a Senior HR Forecaster/Business Intelligence Analyst.
 What does the HR Systems & Reporting team do?
 This team oversees the analysis of Human Resource data in order to identify trends in the workforce and opportunities for the organization to improve our processes. This team also ensures integrity of the HR Systems data, and supports accurate reporting for analysis and presentation. 
What you will do:  Working alongside Juveth Loresco (Manager, Workforce Planning & Data Analytics) you will be responsible for leading planning, design, and optimization of People Services (HR) and Workforce Scheduling business application solutions including data warehouse development and/or enhancement of the data warehouse architecture to support departmental business needs in a sustainable and scalable manner. Some specifics include:

Working closely with Clinical and Operational Leaders, People Services teams such as Workforce Scheduling and other organizational stakeholders to determine business requirements and analyze their metrics.
Conducting statistical analysis, produces business models and forecasts, and develops and maintains performance indicators, comprehensive reports and tools using current business analytical methods and software.
Recommending and participating in the implementation of interventions to optimize workforce utilization and talent acquisition planning both on a short-term and long-term basis to ensure Providence Health Care has the right staff, in the right place and the right time.
Providing input into the development and implementation of policies and procedures for data stewardship and data governance.

About you:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field.
Five (5) years of recent, related experience in data warehousing, significant experience using Microsoft BI Suite (SSMS, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), forecasting and analytics 
Ability to understand business requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications.
Ability to foster collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

The following skills/experience would be considered an asset:

Experience with HR and health care data.
Software development experience.
Experience working with Tableau or other data visualization software.

About us:
 Driven by compassion and social justice, we are at the forefront of exceptional care and innovation. Our organization, Providence Health Care, is a proud winner of three prestigious awards:

2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employers
2021 BC’s Top Employers
2021 Canada’s Top Employers for Young People

What we offer:

The salary range for this role is $77,822 - $111,869 per year, depending on experience.
A comprehensive health benefit package, including dental, vision, and life coverage.
An orientation session and comprehensive onboarding to all new hires.
A chance to grow professionally and personally, as part of a supportive team driven by innovation and the desire to address the future health needs of patients, families and our communities.

We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent. If your experience is close to the qualifications listed here, please still consider applying.
 Providence Health Care is committed to creating an equitable and inclusive workplace for all employees. We strongly believe in an environment where everyone feels valued and respected, which is reflected in our motto “how you want to be treated.” We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, and encourage applications from underrepresented communities, including (but not limited to) BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+, immigrants, and people with disabilities.

Title: Sr Business Info Mgmt Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Business Information Management (BIM) at TD is part of a creative, enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Roles in BIM are highly professional and valued, specialized yet inter-connected and focused on making the availability of business information to designers, developers and decision-makers a priority, all with a united purpose to serve customers and continually build a better bank.
 We're looking for analytical and agile professionals who can merge and translate data into technology and business information, serving today's business needs and setting in motion TD's longer-term goals and strategic objectives.
 If you get data, its power and potential, we think you'll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.



Job Description

Are you an expert level business information analyst, equipped with both conceptual and practical expertise in business information management? If so, this role offers a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business technical leadership across a broad range of information management functions to support various areas of data and analytics.
 Enjoy partnering with colleagues and directing data traffic? In this advanced professional role, you'll work both independently and within teams as a senior lead analyst. Colleagues and business partners will look to you to manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of business data management solutions, including larger projects.
 As a Senior Business Information Management Analyst, you will:

 Be the expert-level team analyst, considered an authority with in-depth knowledge and experience in your field of specialty as well as working knowledge of broader related areas
 Lead projects of moderate to complex risk and resource requirements; may lead end-to-end processes or functional programs
 Analyze and understand business and data requirements to develop complete business solutions (e.g. analysis of data models, entity relationship diagrams, data lifecycle management, governance, lineage, metadata and reporting elements)
 Develop business requirements; design and implement complex business data information management frameworks
 Apply automation and innovation on data platforms and on new development projects / initiatives
 Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your in-depth experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirements aligned to business needs and for specific data platforms, applications systems and servers
 Partner and collaborate with business and technology partners to resolve data / application issues and ensure requirements delivery
 Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Five (5) or more years relevant experience from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background
 Sound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialty
 Fluent in one or two programming languages
 Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
 Proficient knowledge of various data sources, tools and technologies used in preparing summaries/reports
 In-depth knowledge of competitor and market trends
 Proficient to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
 Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
 Strong ability to work collaboratively and independently, communicate effectively (both speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building relationships across teams and functions
 Act as a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externally




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
